Description: Body sherd (mended from six fragments and added plaster) of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; two added white bands at top as preserved; below, frieze of lotus buds alternating with tongues in added red and added white between pairs of white bands; below, frieze of alternating red and white tongues; exterior: foot of animal on wall; below, billet pattern between pairs of dilute lines; below, in handle zone, part of handle frill, and, to right, part of double guilloche band; below, six brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice kraters are typical vase shapes in both Mature Animal and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1534) (phase 2)
